name: Half Moon Bay Lodge

reviews.text: We enjoyed our 2 night stay at this property. After touring other cities in the area, we wanted a couple of days of relaxation, and this property was perfect. Room was a nice size with plenty of room for my family of 4 (2 queen beds), very clean, comfortable, and we appreciated the back patio overlooking the golf course, heated swimming pool and really nice spa area, outdoor fireplace (it was chilly in June!) in-room fridge, coffee, wet-bar area, high-end complimentary toiletries and good internet access. The included breakfast was so nice, too. Fresh items both cold and a few hot items (great waffles :) in an atmosphere that makes you feel as if you are in a nice restaurant. Even though it is self-service, the atmosphere really makes a difference - real plates, cups and silverware, classical music playing, fireplace/hearth, etc. Room service is available for lunch/dinner from adjacent restaurant (did not use, but was available if needed). Landscaping around the property is beautiful, and well-tended. I loved sitting around the pool area and watching the hummingbirds. My only disappointments were on the first night, there was lots of noise from the room above us, but it must have been vacant on the second night because it was quiet. Also, there is no air conditioning at this property, only central heating unit. For the most part, I would imagine that it is not needed, but our room did get a bit stuffy by the morning when it was all closed up for the night. When we were in the room, we keep the patio door open for a cool breeze and the bathroom window open to circulate air in there. Although the window is very high, and has a screen and translucent glass when you close it, it still felt weird to have the window open while showering and such, and hearing the people walking by. We closed/locked both the patio door and bathroom window when retiring for the night, and with ceiling fan on it was ok for most of the night. By the time morning came, it was a bit stuffy and we needed some fresh air. Keep in mind that the temps here in June were in the upper 50's during the day, and low 40's at night. Even with this, we enjoyed our stay very much. This is an affordable option with lots extras that make it feel special. I would stay again.
reviews.title: Very nice property, budget friendly with lots of extras

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Poorly maintained room. First off, as we were leaving for a massage the slider did not lock. When I called the front desk the person said "Oh, well it is pretty safe around here." Really? You know everyone that checked in? You can guarantee the couple who looked like they had not showered in days, who were hitch hiking in front of Original Joes were not going to come onto the property? You know that no one stopping at Original Joes would not cross over to the hotels parking lot (no fence), and look for rooms unlocked? (I saw at least four people walking across the back lawn where this unlocked slider door was. I don't care if they are wearing polo shirts, anyone can come in and steal my laptop!) So after insisting she send someone, and after being told they might not be able to fix it, someone comes (Now mind you, I am now late for my massage at Cloud Nine, all because the management here cannot maintain their locks.) He fiddles with it, slams the door, opens the door, fiddles some more and some more (no tools were being used), and opens and shuts it (as my massage time is a ticking) and finally he gets it to lock. I ask what was wrong. He does not know, now it is locked. Guess I don't get to open my door again (and when I do in the morning, I cannot lock it to go to breakfast, meaning I had to pack my car first and drag my damn lap top to breakfast).
reviews.title: Not worth the price; Poor customer service

reviews.text: Ceiling fan was not working and there was no switch for it (was it only for looks, in this room that was now 85 degrees with the heater off?), so at 11pm I was brought a fan which was so dirty and dusty I had to wipe it down and wash my hands after handling it. Needless to say, my nightgown got the dirt on it and I could not longer wear it. I do not understand why the desk person did not wipe it down. (We stayed on June 10, 2013 in room 115).
reviews.title: Great hotel near golf course

reviews.text: Water pressure in shower was non existant. I have long hair and it took me over five minutes of standing there to rinse hair. I finally got out of the shower and finished in the sink. The only way the sliding bathroom door would close was by slamming it shut, otherwise it stopped three inches shy. Not a pleasant smell when one wants the door closed. Opening this door was hard, once I slammed it entirely shut. Hmmm, not a very good ADA room.
reviews.title: Loved our stay at the Half Moon Bay Lodge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A terrible room overall considering the price paid ($180 with tax).
reviews.title: Great hotel in great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 4 nights. Location very good -- easy to reach sites of great beauty: the ocean (15 min. walking or 5 min. driving), Coastside Trail, Pursima Creek Preserve, the town of Half Moon Bay. Surprisingly, only 40 mins.+/- from SFO. Small, quiet and relaxing, all rooms open in the rear to manicured gardens and golf course vistas. Our "basic" 1st floor room was unexpectedly large and well-appointed, including private patio, refrigerator and sink at entry that could serve as a wet bar. Our relatives' "basic" room on 2nd floor seemed even larger with cathedral ceilings and a balcony. Pool, hot tub beautifully maintained; also a small exercise room with sauna. "Continental Breakfast" included real scrambled eggs replenished frequently, waffles, sausage, juices, teas and coffee, plus an array of pastries and breads which delighted my husband. The lovely breakfast room overlooking the pool was quiet, charming, and had classical music playing - no TV blaring! Hotel doesn't have its own restaurant for lunch and dinner, but Joe's, right in front of the hotel, on Hwy.1, has good fresh, well-prepared food and will provide room service. Good beds. Any request was met with an immediate and helpful response. Virtually everything about Half Moon Bay Lodge was better than expected. The value is exceptional, if you reserve via hotel website. I've been traveling for business over 20 years and stayed in hundreds of hotels/motels - couldn't have been more pleased!
reviews.title: Spacious rooms, lovely grounds, super staff, great value

reviews.text: We spent one night at Half Moon Bay Lodge and were very pleased. Although we only live forty-miles away, we decided to spend the weekend at the coast, visiting the elephant seals at Ano Nuevo State Beach, as well as the Moss Beach Tidepools. HMB Lodge was a perfect location. Our young daughter LOVED the heated swimming pool, and we loved the lovely hot tub/gazebo. And breakfast is included, which far exceeded most 'free breakfast' at hotels. Excellent. Yes, some of the decor is a bit dated to the 80's, but they were actively upgrading rooms while we were there. Although this is no Ritz Carlton (which is behind the HMB Lodge), it is perfect for moderate budgets and taste. Our room was very spacious, and all have decks overlooking a golf course and much greenery. You can drive into HMB for dinner, we stuck with old-school Joe's next door, which was okay. Highly recommend HMB Lodge if you are exploring the coast!
reviews.title: Wonderful getaway location!

reviews.text: Last minute trip to the coast for Valentines weekend--unable to find a room on the water since it was spur of the moment. I was impressed from the moment of check-in. Staff was friendly and professional and we found our room to be comfortable and clean.
reviews.title: Nice location., well appointed rooms

reviews.text: We chose the most basic of rooms, to be fair....we were arriving late and leaving by 10 the next morning, so we did not consider a more luxurious room for this particular stop; however, I didn't expect to find an 'upgraded motel 6' as our room!
reviews.title: Lovely exterior and Grounds; Very basic room; horrible breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The structure and grounds of this lodge are quite pretty. Lush plants, green grass, pretty flowers dot the landscape. The golf course behind lends itself to making this place have a great setting. The ocean is not far away and there are snippets of it that can be seen in the distance.
reviews.title: Great overnight stop.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in one of their redecorated rooms at a special value rate. Room was tastefully done and the bed was one the best ever. Complimentary breakfast was excellent. Desk staff was helpful. Still a few signs of old rooms--drain in tub didn't work.
reviews.title: A pleasant stay

reviews.text: This hotel was nice and QUIET! It is located right on a golf course (my destination was the beach, which is why I gave the location section 4/5). My girlfriend and I reserved the "Dinner & A Movie" package direct from the hotel website the night before our stay. For the value, we couldn't pass it up. The distillery had EXCELLENT food and A GREAT view of the sunset. I was unable to make my reservations for our desired time, but the Hotel made us the exact reservation we wanted! The hotel told us exactly when the Sunday was so we could get the the restaurant on time and get a window seat. When we got back from our fantastic dinner we rented a movie on the flat screen in our room. There was no limit on the cost of the movie we could rent, so we rented a new release movie priced at like 17 bucks... For Free!! We had an all around wonderful experience with this hotel and I would recommend it to anyone looking for a nice place to stay and not wanting to spend 500/room at an overrated place like the Ritz hahaha! Stay at the Lodge!
reviews.title: Needed to get away for a night and this is just what the doctor ordered!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Half Moon Bay Lodge for a weekend. We took advantage of the Renovation Special online. Loved the location, on a golf course, rooms overlooking the garden. The renovations were not in the way at all. We booked the Deluxe King, large room with fireplace and terrace. The terrace has two chairs and a small table to enjoy the gardens below or watch golfers land in the sand trap. Front desk was very nice and professional. Made us feel very welcomed at check in. We will stay here again, DEFINITELY!
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay for a Getaway

reviews.text: Half Moon Bay Lodge is a pleasant and located in a quiet area, set back from the busy coast highway. It is adjacent to a local golf course, which had nice views from our 2nd story room. The beach areas are several miles away, so if you want an ocean view, look elsewhere. The rooms were clean and comfortable, and the staff was friendly. The complimentary breakfast was a nice touch. Half Moon Bay is a small town, but has several nice restaurants and interesting shopping in the old downtown area. It is minutes away from one of our favorite brew pubs, which is an authentic British Pub with a restaurant. It's less than a hour's drive to Santa Cruz, and about the same to San Francisco airport. If you want a comfortable, quiet stay while you roam the California coast, this is a good choice.
reviews.title: Forget the ocean view!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is the second time we have stayed at the Half Moon Bay Lodge. The first time was when it was under the Best Western Management. Both times were very nice, but they have been doing remodels recently and they are very nice. Rooms are large and comfortable. We had a king fireplace room with a nice balcony (2nd floor) which over looks the golf course and if you look really hard, you can even see the sun setting on the horizon,
reviews.title: Nice Relaxing Get a Way
Just arrived, WOW
reviews.text: Have stayed here over @ 20 years and the rooms have been completely renovated. You would think it was brand new with trendy look. The staff had pulled up our previous room preferences and we stayed in 230. Upper floor end of a building, perfect. Ask for end rooms for the best.

Staff were very helpful and went above-and-beyond more than once to meet a request. Rooms, lobby and breakfast room were neat and clean. It is a 20 minute walk to the Pacific coast at the Ritz-Carlton. The complimentary breakfast was a pleasant surprise. Room was re-organized daily, was clean, and things put in order while leaving personal items untouched. Very accessible since right off Highway 1 - a pleasant drive in either direction to see coastal scenery. We enjoyed Filoli Estate which is only 20 minutes by car.
reviews.title: Nice Experience

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel since the Ritz Carlton Half Moon Bay was sold out for one night. This is a small hotel/lodge nestled back off of Cabrillo Hwy. What I didn't know was you can play golf on the property. My room was clean, the bed was comfy and the staff very courteous and attentive. I wished I could have stayed longer to check out all the amenities, but I was in Half Moon Bay on business and only slept there and returned to the Ritz Carlton during the day for meetings. I will definitely visit again when I have more time.
reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This property looks and seems like it was a very rundown property at one time. New management has moved in and they are making a lot of changes. New furniture, paint and a new lobby. But you can still see the ghosts of bad days. The bed was comfortable, but there was a slight smell of garbage. It wasn't in the sheets or bedding, maybe in the carpet? Maybe a dead animal in the wall? Unfortunately I did not notice this smell until the middle of the night or I would have asked for another room. The pool area was nice. The breakfast buffet was good.
reviews.title: You can do better

reviews.text: This road side lodge has golf course views. No elevators so lugging suitcases is a pain up to second floor. Encountered surly Sara at checkin. Big comfort rooms with fireplaces but no matches and had a difficult time with fire bags with kindling and pressed wood. Breakfast room is small but they offered waffles, eggs, cereal and muffins with juices and coffee. Hot tub was nice. Quiet and comfortable and enjoyed cookies in lobby!
reviews.title: Comfy beds and fireplaces
Great Stay in Half Moon Bay!
reviews.text: We loved the Half Moon Bay Lodge. The front desk staff was very friendly & helpful. Our standard king room was large with vaulted ceilings and a nice balcony overlooking the golf course! The bed was comfortable and everything was very updated. Be sure to check out the hot tub and the nice outdoor fireplace.

aka: Best Western Plus Half Moon Bay Hotel Half Moon Bay
description: Half Moon Bay, California is located only 30 minutes from San Francisco and Silicon Valley in one of the Northern California's most charming seaside villages. The recently renovated Half Moon Bay Lodge offers gracious hospitality, luxurious guestrooms and exceptional conference facilities for groups up to 60. Near our Half Moon Bay hotel, you’ll discover white-sand beaches, fishing, diving, surfing, and horseback riding. Half Moon Bay dining and antique shopping are also within easy reach of the lodge and its scenic setting overlooking the Arnold Palmer designed Golf Links. Attractions near the Half Moon Bay Lodge include 36 holes of oceanfront golf, horseback riding, whale watching, kayaking, the Pigeon Point Lighthouse and the Purisima Creek Redwoods Open Space Preserve.
